children.text: It sorts the list, then subtracts each element from x in order until x becomes negative.

children.text: The number of elements subtracted before that happens is the output. So the output is the number of elements processed before x becomes negative, or N-1 if all were used but x was still positive.

  ! Process first character

  first_char_ascii = ichar(str_num(1:1))

  result_char = char(first_char_ascii + 1)

  ! Output

end program main

The full Fortran code:

program main
  implicit none
  integer :: N, i, num, first_char_ascii
  integer(8) :: x, a
  integer(8), allocatable :: sweet(:)
  character(len=20) :: str_num
  character(1) :: result_char

  ! Read input
  read*, N, x
  allocate(sweet(N))
  do i = 1, N
     read*, a
     sweet(i) = a
  end do

  ! Sort the array
  call sort(sweet)

  ! Compute num
  num = 0
  do while (num < N)
     if (x >= sweet(num+1)) then
        x = x - sweet(num+1)
        num = num + 1
     else
        exit
     end if
  end do

  ! Check if all elements were subtracted and x is still positive
  if (num == N .and. x > 0) then
     num = num - 1
  end if

  ! Convert num to string
  write(str_num, '(i0)') num

  ! Process first character
  first_char_ascii = ichar(str_num(1:1))
  result_char = char(first_char_ascii + 1)

  ! Output
  write(*, '(A)', advance='no') result_char

end program main
